column17: she was the daughter of shirley ann (jones) trought of royersford
column18: pa and the late leland p. trought. she had her own medical transcription business
column19: and also worked at phoenixville hospital laboratory and oncology departments. lori was a member of grace assembly of god church in spring city where she sang on the worship team and in the choir. lori taught junior church
column20: helped with the children's programs and sang at many other churches. she had a heart for missions
column21: and she journeyed with her family on a mission trip to the dominican republic
column22: where she served at cure international. she also loved rose gardening and animals. surviving in addition to her husband and mother are: daughter
column23: courtney wife of scott russum of coatesville
column28: james and carolyn farrell of limerick
